(n) material produced by or used in a reaction involving changes in atoms or molecules
Synonyms: chemical substance

Synonyms: conjunctive

>>> coordinating conjunction

(n) a conjunction (like `and' or `or') that connects two identically constructed grammatical constituents

(n) the coordination by conjunction of linguistic units of the same status

(n) a stanza consisting of two successive lines of verse

(n) two items of the same kind
Synonyms: span

>>> cohesion

(n) (physics) the intermolecular force that holds together the molecules in a solid or liquid

(n) (botany) the process in some plants of parts growing together that are usually separate (such as petals)

(n) the state of cohering or sticking together
Synonyms: coherence

>>> covalent bond

(n) a chemical bond that involves sharing a pair of electrons between atoms in a molecule

>>> cross-link

(n) a side bond that links two adjacent chains of atoms in a complex molecule
Synonyms: cross-linkage

(v) to join by creating covalent bonds of adjacent chains of a polymer or protein

>>> cross-linkage

(n) a side bond that links two adjacent chains of atoms in a complex molecule
Synonyms: cross-link

>>> coordinate bond

(n) a covalent bond in which both electrons are provided by one of the atoms
Synonyms: dative bond

>>> chemical energy

(n) that part of the energy in a substance that can be released by a chemical reaction

>>> chinook wind

(n) a warm dry wind blowing down the eastern slopes of the Rockies
Synonyms: chinook

>>> chromatic aberration

(n) an optical aberration in which the image has colored fringes

>>> cold wave

(n) a wave of unusually cold weather

>>> compartment pressure

(n) the air pressure maintained in an air-tight compartment especially in an aircraft

>>> corpuscular-radiation pressure

(n) the minute pressure exerted on a surface normal to the direction of propagation of a wave
Synonyms: radiation pressure

>>> cell death

(n) (physiology) the normal degeneration and death of living cells (as in various epithelial cells)
Synonyms: necrobiosis

>>> corpuscular radiation

(n) a stream of atomic or subatomic particles that may be charged positively (e.g. alpha particles) or negatively (e.g. beta particles) or not at all (e.g. neutrons)
Synonyms: particulate radiation

>>> caspase-mediated cell death

(n) a type of cell death in which the cell uses specialized cellular machinery to kill itself
Synonyms: apoptosis

>>> cerebral death

(n) death when respiration and other reflexes are absent
Synonyms: brain death

>>> carrier wave

(n) a radio wave that can be modulated in order to transmit a signal
Synonyms: carrier

>>> cloudburst

(n) a heavy rain
Synonyms: waterspout

>>> chemiluminescence

(n) luminescence resulting from a chemical reaction as the oxidation of luciferin in fireflies

>>> conductance

(n) a material's capacity to conduct electricity

>>> cell wall

(n) a rigid layer of polysaccharides enclosing the membrane of plant and prokaryotic cells

>>> crustose thallus

(n) thin crusty lichen thallus

>>> calyptra

(n) the hood or cap covering the calyx of certain plants: e.g., the California poppy

>>> cleistothecium

(n) closed spore-bearing structure of some fungi (especially Aspergillaceae and Erysiphaceae) from which spores are released only by decay or disintegration
Synonyms: cleistocarp

>>> cleistocarp

(n) closed spore-bearing structure of some fungi (especially Aspergillaceae and Erysiphaceae) from which spores are released only by decay or disintegration
Synonyms: cleistothecium

>>> color spectrum

(n) the distribution of colors produced when light is dispersed by a prism
Synonyms: visible spectrum

>>> conduction

(n) the transmission of heat or electricity or sound
Synonyms: conductivity

>>> conductivity

(n) the transmission of heat or electricity or sound
Synonyms: conduction

>>> conditions

(n) the atmospheric conditions that comprise the state of the atmosphere in terms of temperature and wind and clouds and precipitation
Synonyms: weather

(n) the set of circumstances that affect someone's welfare

(n) the prevailing context that influences the performance or the outcome of a process

>>> current electricity

(n) a flow of electric charge
Synonyms: dynamic electricity

>>> current of air

(n) air moving (sometimes with considerable force) from an area of high pressure to an area of low pressure
Synonyms: wind

>>> color force

(n) in physics, the interaction that binds protons and neutrons together in the nuclei of atoms
Synonyms: strong force

(n) a nonmotile spore of red algae

(n) an asexually produced fungal spore formed on a conidiophore
Synonyms: conidiospore

>>> conidiospore

(n) an asexually produced fungal spore formed on a conidiophore
Synonyms: conidium

>>> conidiophore

(n) a specialized fungal hypha that produces conidia

>>> class Cycadopsida

(n) palmlike gymnosperms: includes the surviving order Cycadales and several extinct orders
Synonyms: subdivision Cycadophytina, subdivision Cycadophyta

>>> cycad

(n) any tropical gymnosperm of the order Cycadales

>>> cycad family

(n) ancient palmlike plants closely related to ferns in that fertilization is by means of spermatozoids

>>> cryptogam

(n) formerly recognized taxonomic group including all flowerless and seedless plants that reproduce by means of spores: ferns, mosses, algae, fungi
